translation: These three images were all made of brass and stone, cast in a dignified and solemn manner. The traces of their mysterious appearance are far off.

translation: Each of the relics in the monastery contained one sheng. The spiritual light sometimes shone, and miraculous signs occurred at intervals.

source_sentence: 鞮羅釋迦伽藍西南九十餘里，至大山，雲石幽蔚，靈僊攸舍，毒蛇、暴龍窟穴其藪，
translation: More than ninety li to the southwest of the monastery of Śākyamuni Buddha, one reaches a great mountain surrounded by clouds and stones that cast their spells on the living beings in seclusion. There are poisonous snakes and violent dragons in the caves and holes in the thickets.

source_sentence: 猛獸、鷙鳥棲伏其林。
translation: Fierce animals and birds of prey perched in the forest.

translation: At the top of the mountain there was a large flat rock, on which was built a stupa more than ten feet high. This was the place where the Buddha entered into meditation.

source_sentence: 昔者如來降神止此，坐斯磐石，入滅盡定，時經宿焉。
translation: Formerly the Tathāgata descended to this place and stayed there. He was seated on that huge rock, entered into absorption of extinction, and spent the night there.

source_sentence: 諸天靈聖供養如來，鼓天樂，雨天花。
translation: The gods and spirits offered offerings to the Tathāgata, playing heavenly music and raining heavenly flowers.

source_sentence: 如來出定，諸天感慕，以寶金銀起窣堵波。
translation: When the Tathāgata emerged from absorption, the gods admired him and built a stupa of precious gold and silver.

source_sentence: 去聖逾邈，寶變為石。
translation: The treasures were transformed into stone after the departure of the sage and beyond.

source_sentence: 自古迄今，人未有至。
translation: Since ancient times no one has visited this place.

source_sentence: 遙望高山，乃見異類，長蛇、猛獸群從右旋，天仙靈聖肩隨讚禮。
translation: Looking up the high mountain from a distance, he saw strange creatures such as long snakes and fierce animals circling to his right. Deva spirits and holy ones bowed with their shoulders in praise of him.

source_sentence: 山東岡有窣堵波，在昔如來佇觀摩揭陀國所履之處也。
translation: In a hill to the east of the mountain is a stupa built at the place where the Tathāgata once walked and contemplated the country of Magadha.

source_sentence: 山西北三十餘里，山阿有伽藍，負嶺崇基，疎崖峙閣。
translation: More than thirty li to the northwest of the mountain, at the base of a hill there is a monastery built with lofty foundations supporting the range and separated by steep cliffs in a raised pavilion.

source_sentence: 僧徒五十餘人，並習大乘法教。
translation: There were more than fifty monks, all of whom studied Mahayana teachings.

source_sentence: 瞿那末底(唐言德慧)菩薩伏外道之處。
translation: Gotamatī (known as Guṇamati in Chinese) is a place where the bodhisattva subdues non-Buddhists.

source_sentence: 初，此山中有外道摩沓婆者，祖僧佉之法而習道焉。
translation: At first, there was a heretic named Mādhava on this mountain whose ancestors practiced Buddhism in accordance with the teachings of the Saṃkhya school.

source_sentence: 學窮內外，言極空有，名高前列，德重當時。
translation: He studied extensively both Buddhist and heretical doctrines, saying that the ultimate emptiness exists. His name was so lofty as to be listed in the front row; his virtue prevailed at the time.

source_sentence: 君王珍敬，謂之國寶，臣庶宗仰，咸曰家師。
translation: The ruler treasured and venerated it as the national treasure, and his ministers and common people esteemed it as a teacher of the family.

source_sentence: 隣國學人承風仰德，儔之先進，誠博達也。
translation: The scholars of the neighboring countries inherited the style and revered their virtue, and they cherished it as an advancement. They were sincerely learned and erudite.

source_sentence: 食邑二城，環居封建。
translation: The two cities of Yeo and Wu are the feudal monasteries that make up the enclosures.

source_sentence: 時南印度德慧菩薩幼而敏達，早擅精微，學通三藏，理窮四諦。
translation: Guṇamati Bodhisattva of South India at that time was a young and intelligent bodhisattva. Early he mastered the subtleties and studied the Tripiṭaka, comprehending the four truths in principle.

source_sentence: 聞摩沓婆論極幽微，有懷挫銳，命一門人裁書謂曰：「敬問摩沓婆善安樂也。
translation: When he heard that Mādhava’s theories were deep and profound, some of his disciples harbored resentment. He ordered a disciple to write a letter to him, saying: I respectfully inquire about the well-being of Mādhava.

source_sentence: 宜忘勞弊，精習舊學，三年之後，摧汝嘉聲。」
translation: It's better to forget the trouble and study your old studies, and after three years have passed, I'll destroy your good reputation.

source_sentence: 如是第二、第三年中，每發使報。
translation: Thus, in the second and third years, he always sent an envoy to report back.

source_sentence: 及將發迹，重裁書曰：「年期已極，學業何如？
translation: When he was about to leave the monastery, he wrote a letter again, saying, “The duration of my journey has come to an end.

source_sentence: 吾今至矣，汝宜知之。」
translation: Now that I've arrived, you should know about it.

source_sentence: 摩沓婆甚懷惶懼，誡諸門人及以邑戶：「自今之後，不得居止沙門異道，

source_sentence: 遞相宣告，勿有犯違。」
translation: They'll proclaim each other, so there won't be any violations.

source_sentence: 時德慧菩薩杖錫而來，至摩沓婆邑，人守約，莫有相舍。

source_sentence: 諸婆羅門更詈之曰：「斷髮殊服，何異人乎？

translation: It's better to leave quickly at the right time; don't stop here!

translation: Desiring to destroy the heretics, Guṇamati Bodhisattva wished to stay in that city. Because of his compassion, he humbly apologized and said, “Your pure practice is based on worldly truth.

source_sentence: 我又勝義諦之淨行，淨行既同，何為見拒？」
translation: I am also the pure practice of the ultimate truth, and since my pure practice is the same, why would I reject it?

translation: The Brāhmaṇa refused to give his words, but simply expelled them.

translation: On the sixth day, he died in the blood of a cow.

translation: When he was about to die, he asked his wife, You're so highly talented that you won't forget your shame!

translation: The crowd all shouted and said to each other, Mādhava is self-conceited about his talents and shameful of virtue and wisdom, so he sent his wife to come; it's clear that superiority and inferiority are distinct.

translation: The Bodhisattva of Virtue and Wisdom said to his wife, If you can restrain yourself, I've restrained him.

translation: It's now the right time to skillfully collect and transform them.

translation: All we ask, Your majesty, is that the householders of Mādhava’s township always serve as monks and nuns for a thousand generations, so that they may be instructed to send down this letter of admonition in order to spread its fame without limit.

source_sentence: 唯彼淨信見匡護者福延于世，食用同僧，以勸清信，以褒厚德。」
translation: Only those with pure faith who see and protect the Buddha's blessings are prolonged in the world, eat together with the saṃgha to encourage pure faith and praise his great virtue.

source_sentence: 於是建此伽藍，式旌勝迹。
translation: So this monastery was built in order to mark the place where the stupas were constructed.

source_sentence: 初，摩沓婆論敗之後，十數淨行逃難隣國，告諸外道恥辱之事，招募英俊，

source_sentence: 來雪前恥。
translation: It's a shame that comes from the past snow.

translation: Please, great master, destroy the heretics!

translation: Guṇamati said, It's advisable to gather a treatise.

source_sentence: 於是外道學人欣然相慰：「我曹今日，勝其必矣。」
translation: The non-Buddhist students then joyfully congratulated each other, saying, Today, I'll surely overcome them.

source_sentence: 時諸外道闡揚義理，德慧菩薩曰：「今諸外道逃難遠遊，如王先制，皆是賤人，
translation: The heretics then expounded the doctrine. Guṇamati Bodhisattva said, “The heretics are now fleeing and traveling far away like the king who has previously decreed that they should all be inferior people.

source_sentence: 我今如何與彼對論？」
translation: How can I now discuss it with them?

source_sentence: 德慧有負座竪，素聞餘論，頗閑微旨，侍立於側，聽諸高談。
translation: Guṇamati sat cross-legged at the side of his seat and listened to the lofty discussions.

source_sentence: 德慧拊其座而言曰：「床，汝可論。」
translation: Guṇamati stood cross-legged at his seat and said, Seat, you may discuss it.

source_sentence: 眾咸驚駭，異其所命。
translation: The people were all terrified and differed from what they had been told.

source_sentence: 時負座竪便即發難，深義泉涌，清辯響應。
translation: When he held his seat cross-legged, he then raised an objection, profound and meaningful, with a clear and eloquent resonance.

source_sentence: 三復之後，外道失宗，重挫其銳，再折其翮。
translation: After three rounds the heretics lost their theories, crushing their sharpness and refuting their weaknesses.

source_sentence: 自伏論已來，立為伽藍邑戶。
translation: After he had subdued his disputes, he established the monastery as a townhouse.

source_sentence: 德慧伽藍西南二十餘里，至孤山，有伽藍，尸羅跋陀羅(唐言戒賢)論師論義得勝，
translation: More than twenty li to the southwest of the monastery of Virtue and Wisdom one reaches an isolated hill, where there is a monastery in which the śīlabhadra (known as Jīvaka in Chinese) śāstra master Silabhadra (known as Huixuan in Chinese) won the treatise.

source_sentence: 捨邑建焉。
translation: He abandoned the town and built it.

source_sentence: 竦一危峯，如窣堵波，置佛舍利。
translation: A dangerous peak was raised, resembling a stupa in which to place the Buddha’s relic bones are preserved.

source_sentence: 論師，三摩呾吒國之王族，婆羅門之種也。
translation: The śāstra master was a royal native of the country of Samataṭa and a brahman by caste.

source_sentence: 少好學，有風操，遊諸印度，詢求明哲。
translation: As a young boy he was fond of learning and had good manners. He traveled to various parts of India in search of the wise and intelligent.

source_sentence: 至此國那爛陀僧伽藍，遇護法菩薩，聞法信悟。
translation: When he arrived at the monastery of Nalanda Monastery in this country, he met Dharmapāla Bodhisattva, who heard the Dharma and believed in enlightenment.

source_sentence: 請服染衣，諮以究竟之致，問以解脫之路，既窮至理，亦究微言，名擅當時，
translation: He was invited to dress in dyed robes and asked questions about the ultimate truth. Inquiring about the path leading to liberation, he mastered both the ultimate truth and the subtle theories. His reputation prevailed at that time.

source_sentence: 聲高異域。
translation: The sound is lofty in a different land.

source_sentence: 南印度有外道，探賾索隱，窮幽洞微，聞護法高名，起我慢深嫉，不阻山川，
translation: In southern India there was a heretic who traveled in seclusion through the mountainous jungles. He heard that the Dharma protector was renowned and became jealous of his self-conceit, so he did not obstruct the paths of the mountains and rivers.

source_sentence: 擊鼓求論，曰：「我，南印度之人也。
translation: He beat the drum and asked for a treatise, saying, “I am a native of South India.

source_sentence: 承王國內有大論師，我雖不敏，願與詳議。」
translation: It's because there's a great treatise master in the kingdom, and even though I'm not sharp, I want to discuss it with him.

source_sentence: 王曰：「有之，誠如議也。」
translation: The king said, Yes, it's exactly as you say.

source_sentence: 乃命使臣請護法曰：「南印度有外道，不遠千里，來求較論，唯願降跡，
translation: So he ordered his envoy to summon Dharmapāla, saying: There is a heretic from southern India not far from me at a distance of one thousand li who wishes to hold a debate.

source_sentence: 赴集論場。」
translation: He went to the assembly's discussion hall.

source_sentence: 護法聞已，攝衣將往。
translation: After hearing this, Dharmapāla gathered his robes and was about to leave.

source_sentence: 門人戒賢者，後進之翹楚也，前進請曰：「何遽行乎？」
translation: The disciples of the preceptor, who was a follower of Jing Chu, advanced forward and asked, Why are you going so quickly?

source_sentence: 護法曰：「自慧日潛暉，傳燈寂照，外道蟻聚，異學蜂飛，故我今者，
translation: The Dharma protector said, “The sun of self-knowledge shines brightly and transmits a ray of light. Non-Buddhist monks are like ants and heretics fly like bees. That is why I am the present [in heaven].

source_sentence: 將摧彼論。」
translation: I'll destroy that treatise.

source_sentence: 戒賢曰：「恭聞餘論，敢摧異道。」
translation: Śākyamuni said, Listen to the rest of the treatise and dare to destroy the heretics.

source_sentence: 護法知其俊也，因而允焉。
translation: Knowing that he was good-looking, Dharmapāla agreed with him.

source_sentence: 是時戒賢年甫三十，眾輕其少，恐難獨任。
translation: At the time, Silabhadra was only thirty years old, and the crowd despised him for being so young that they were afraid he wouldn't be able to leave them alone.

source_sentence: 護法知眾心之不平，乃解之曰：「有貴高明，無云齒歲，以今觀之，破彼必矣。」
translation: Knowing that the minds of the monks were unequal, Dharmapāla then explained to them, There's a noble and lofty man who doesn't say his teeth are old; now that he's observing them, he'll surely break them.

source_sentence: 逮乎集論之日，遠近相趨，少長咸萃。
translation: On the day of the assembly’s discussion, all the monks and nuns, both old and young, gathered together from far and near to discuss the matter.

source_sentence: 外道弘闡大猷，盡其幽致；
translation: Non-Buddhist theories propagated the Mahayana, expounding all its mysterious teachings.

source_sentence: 戒賢循理責實，深極幽玄。
translation: Vaiśeṣika follows the principle and criticizes the reality, which is profound and mysterious.

source_sentence: 外道辭窮，蒙恥而退。
translation: The heretics withdrew in shame at the exhaustion of their words.

source_sentence: 王用酬德，封此邑城。
translation: The king, in order to repay his virtue, conferred the throne on this city.

source_sentence: 論師辭曰：「染衣之士，事資知足，清淨自守，何以邑為？」
translation: The treatise master said, A dyed-robed man is sufficient in terms of business and knows well enough to keep himself pure, so what's the reason for making a town?

source_sentence: 王曰：「法王晦迹，智舟淪湑，不有旌別，無勵後學。
translation: The king said, “The King of the Dharma is in obscurity and the ship of wisdom has sunk. There is no memorial service for him and there is no encouragement for those who will follow him.

source_sentence: 為弘正法，願垂哀納。」
translation: For the sake of spreading the right teaching, may you have pity and accept it.

source_sentence: 論師辭不獲已，受此邑焉，便建伽藍，窮諸規矩，捨其邑戶，式修供養。
translation: When the śāstra master refused to receive it, he accepted the fief and built a monastery in which all the rules and regulations were fulfilled. He gave up his family’s land for the use of the fief to make offerings accordingly.

source_sentence: 戒賢伽藍西南行四五十里，渡尼連禪河，至伽耶城。
translation: Going southwest for four or five li from the monastery of Silabhadra, I crossed the Nairañjanā River and reached the city of Gayā.

source_sentence: 甚險固，少居人，唯婆羅門有千餘家，大仙人祚胤也，王所不臣，眾咸宗敬。
translation: It is a dangerous and strong place with few inhabitants. Only the brahmans, who belonged to more than one thousand families and were all descendants of great sages, did not serve the king and his followers venerated him.

source_sentence: 城北三十餘里，有清泉，印度相傳謂之聖水，凡有飲濯，罪垢消除。
translation: More than thirty li to the north of the city there is a clear fountain, which is said to be holy water according to Indian tradition. All who drink and bathe in it will get rid of their sins and dirt.

source_sentence: 城西南五六里至伽耶山。
translation: Five or six li to the southwest of the city, he reached Gayā Mountain.

source_sentence: 谿谷杳冥，峯巖危險，印度國俗稱曰靈山，自昔君王馭宇承統，化洽遠人，
translation: Formerly the country was called Lingshan by Indian custom. Since ancient times the ruler ruled over the empire and brought prosperity to the people of distant countries.

source_sentence: 德隆前代，莫不登封而告成功。
translation: In all the previous dynasties virtue prevailed, and none of them succeeded to the throne without ascending it.

source_sentence: 山頂上有石窣堵波，高百餘尺，無憂王之所建也，靈鑒潛被，神光時燭，
translation: On the top of the mountain is a stone stupa more than one hundred feet high, built by King Aśoka. It has latent spiritual powers and often emits a divine light.

source_sentence: 昔如來於此演說《寶雲》等經。
translation: In the past, the Tathāgata explained the Jeweled Cloud and other scriptures here.

source_sentence: 伽耶山東南有窣堵波，迦葉波本生邑也。
translation: To the southeast of Gayā is a stupa built at the place where Kāśyapa was born.

source_sentence: 其南有二窣堵波，則伽耶迦葉波、捺地迦葉波(舊曰那提迦葉，訛也。
translation: To the south of it are two stupas built at the place where Gayā-Kāśyapa and Nadī-Kāśyapa (formerly transcribed incorrectly as Nadī-Kāśyapa) were buried.

translation: Gayā-Kāśyapa served the fire to the east, crossed a big river, and reached the mountain of Paramartial enlightenment (known as “Formerly True Enlightened Mountain” in Chinese).

source_sentence: 先登此山，故云前正覺也)。
translation: He first ascended this mountain, so he's called the former perfectly enlightened one.)

source_sentence: 如來勤求六歲，未成正覺，後捨苦行，示受乳糜，行自東北，遊目此山，
translation: The Tathāgata had been practicing austerities for six years without realizing enlightenment. Later he renounced the ascetic practice of austerities and showed his acceptance of milk gruel. He traveled from the northeast to see this mountain.

source_sentence: 有懷幽寂，欲證正覺。
translation: There are those who harbor a sense of seclusion and want to realize right awakening.

source_sentence: 自東北岡登以至頂，地既震動，山又傾搖。
translation: From the northeast, they climbed up to the top of the mountain and when the earth shook the mountain again swayed.

source_sentence: 山神惶懼，告菩薩曰：「此山者，非成正覺之福地也。
translation: Frightened, the mountain deity told the Bodhisattva, “This mountain is not a blessed place where one can attain enlightenment.

source_sentence: 若止於此，入金剛定，地當震陷，山亦傾覆。」
translation: If he stops here and enters the vajra concentration, the earth will sink and the mountain will also overturn it.

source_sentence: 菩薩下自西南，山半崖中，背巖面澗，有大石室，菩薩即之，加趺坐焉，
translation: At the southwest of the place where the Bodhisattva descended, halfway down the mountain, there was a large rock chamber at the back of the cliff and on the other side of the valley. The Bodhisattva sat cross-legged in this chamber.

source_sentence: 地又震動，山復傾搖。
translation: The earth shook again and the mountain tumbled.

source_sentence: 時淨居天空中唱曰：「此非如來成正覺處。
translation: Jīvaka then called out in the sky, This isn't the place where the Tathāgata becomes perfectly enlightened.

source_sentence: 自此西南十四五里，去苦行處不遠，有卑鉢羅樹，下有金剛座，去來諸佛咸於此座而成正覺，
translation: Fourteen or fifteen li to the southwest of here, not far from the place where they practiced austerities, was a pippala tree with an adamantine throne at the base. All the buddhas that came and went there attained enlightenment on this throne.

source_sentence: 願當就彼。」
translation: I wish to go there.

source_sentence: 菩薩方起，室中龍曰：「斯室清勝，可以證聖，唯願慈悲，勿有遺棄。」
translation: The bodhisattva then got up, and the dragon in his room said, This room is so pure and superior that it's possible to realize sainthood; please be compassionate and don't abandon it.

source_sentence: 菩薩既知非取證所，為遂龍意，留影而去(影在昔日，賢愚咸覩：洎於今時，
translation: Knowing that it was not the place where he had attained enlightenment, the bodhisattva complied with the dragon's wishes and departed leaving his shadow behind. (His shadow used to be there in the past, but good men and foolish people bothered him:

source_sentence: 或有得見)。
translation: Perhaps there's a view of attainment.)

source_sentence: 諸天前導，往菩提樹。
translation: The gods led him before them to the bodhi tree.

source_sentence: 逮乎無憂王之興也，菩薩登山上下之迹，皆樹旌表，建窣堵波，度量雖殊，
translation: The traces of the bodhisattvas climbing up and down the mountains are all enshrined in stupas built with banners and inscriptions, which are different in size.

source_sentence: 靈應莫異，或天花雨空中，或光照幽谷。
translation: Their spiritual responses are no different, either from the heavenly flowers raining in the sky or shining brightly illuminating the deep valleys.

source_sentence: 每歲罷安居日，異方法俗，登修供養，信宿乃還。
translation: Every year on the day of the monastery’s departure from the summer retreat, a different monastic custom is observed. The Master ascended to make offerings to the relics and returned home after the night has passed.

source_sentence: 前正覺山西南行十四五里，至菩提樹。
translation: Going southwest from the former Zhengjue Shan for fourteen or fifteen li, I reached the bodhi tree.

source_sentence: 周垣壘甎，崇峻險固。
translation: The enclosure is surrounded by walls built of brick, which are lofty and strongly fortified.

source_sentence: 東西長，南北狹，周五百餘步。
translation: It is long from east to west and narrow from south to north, more than five hundred paces in circuit.

source_sentence: 奇樹名花，連陰接影；
translation: Exotic trees are called ‘flowers’ and their shadows are connected by the succession of shades.

source_sentence: 細沙異草，彌漫綠被。
translation: The fine sand and strange grass covered the ground with a green covering.

source_sentence: 正門東闢，對尼連禪河，南門接大花池，西阨險固，北門通大伽藍。
translation: The main gate opened to the east and faced the Nairañjanā River. The south gate connected with a large flower pond, the west was narrow and perilous, and the north gate connected with a large monastery.

source_sentence: 壖垣內地，聖迹相隣，或窣堵波，或復精舍，並贍部洲諸國君王、大臣、豪族欽承遺教，
translation: In the inner wall there are holy sites that border one another, some of which are stupas or other monasteries. All the rulers, ministers, and powerful people of Jambudvipa inherited the teachings they had passed down from generation to generation.

source_sentence: 建以記焉。
translation: It was built in order to record it.

source_sentence: 菩提樹垣正中，有金剛座。
translation: At the center of the enclosure of the bodhi tree is a vajra seat.

source_sentence: 昔賢劫初成，與大地俱起，據三千大千世界中，下極金輪，上侵地際，
translation: Formerly, at the beginning of the Bhadrakalpa ( kalpa of good eon), it occurred simultaneously with the earth. It is located in the world system consisting of three thousand great chiliocosms; its circumference is as small as a circle of gold and extends upward to the limit of the earth.

source_sentence: 金剛所成，周百餘步，賢劫千佛坐之而入金剛定，故曰金剛座焉。
translation: It was made of diamond and more than one hundred paces in circumference. The thousand buddhas of the Bhadrakalpa sat there and entered the diamond samādhi; hence it is called the Diamond Seat.

source_sentence: 證聖道所，亦曰道場，大地震動，獨無傾搖。
translation: It was also called the site of enlightenment. The great earthquake shook it but it alone did not shake it.

source_sentence: 是故如來將證正覺也，歷此四隅，地皆傾動，後至此處，安靜不傾。
translation: Because of this, the Tathāgata was about to realize perfect enlightenment and passed through these four corners, where the earth swung down but after arriving at this place it remained still and didn't sink.

source_sentence: 自入末劫，正法浸微，沙土彌覆，無復得見。
translation: In the latter half of the present eon, when the true Dharma subsided, it covered as many worlds as there are grains of sand and soil and no longer remained to be seen.

source_sentence: 佛涅槃後，諸國君王傳聞佛說金剛座量，遂以兩軀觀自在菩薩像，南北標界，
translation: After the nirvana of the Buddha, the monarchs of various countries heard the Buddha teach the dimension of the vajra seat. Thus they produced two images of Avalokiteśvara Bodhisattva in two bodies to mark the boundary between southern and northern directions.

source_sentence: 東面而坐。
translation: He sat facing east.

source_sentence: 聞諸耆舊曰：「此菩薩像身沒不見，佛法當盡。」
translation: I heard some old people say, This bodhisattva's image body has disappeared and won't be seen, and the Buddha's teaching will end.

source_sentence: 今南隅菩薩沒過胸臆矣。
translation: Now, the bodhisattva in the southern corner doesn't go beyond his chest.

source_sentence: 金剛座上菩提樹者，即畢鉢羅之樹也。
translation: The bodhi tree on the vajra seat is the pippala tree.

source_sentence: 昔佛在世，高數百尺，屢經殘伐，猶高四五丈。
translation: Formerly when the Buddha was living in the world he was several hundred feet in height. He often went through excavations but remained as high as four or five zhang.

source_sentence: 佛坐其下成等正覺，因而謂之菩提樹焉。
translation: The Buddha sat under it and became perfectly enlightened, which is why it's called the bodhi tree.

source_sentence: 莖幹黃白，枝葉青翠，冬夏不凋，光鮮無變。
translation: The stems and stems are yellowish white in color and the branches and leaves are blue and green. They do not wither in winter or summer, but their luster remains unchanging.

source_sentence: 每至如來涅槃之日，葉皆凋落，頃之復故。
translation: Every year on the day when the Tathāgata entered nirvana all the leaves withered and disappeared, but after a short while they reappeared.

source_sentence: 是日也，諸國君王，異方法俗，數千萬眾，不召而集，香水香乳，以溉以洗，
translation: On that day the kings of various countries, different in religion and custom, gathered tens of thousands of people without summoning them. They poured fragrant milk and soapy water to irrigate and wash [their bodies].

source_sentence: 於是奏音樂，列香花，燈炬繼日，競修供養。
translation: Thereupon, music was played and incense and flowers were rows of fragrant flowers. Day after day the torches and lamps burned to make offerings in competition.

source_sentence: 如來寂滅之後，無憂王之初嗣位也，信受邪道，毀佛遺迹，興發兵徒，
translation: After the nirvana of the Tathāgata, when King Aśoka first ascended the throne he believed in heretical doctrines and destroyed the traces left by the Buddha.

source_sentence: 躬臨剪伐。
translation: He personally approached the tree and cut it down.

source_sentence: 根莖枝葉，分寸斬截，次西數十步而積聚焉，令事火婆羅門燒以祠天，
translation: The roots, stems, branches, and leaves were cut into small pieces one inch from each other. Ten paces further to the west they accumulated so that fire-worshiping brahmans would burn them as sacrifices to the gods.

source_sentence: 煙焰未靜，忽生兩樹，猛火之中，茂葉含翠，因而謂之灰菩提樹。
translation: Before the smoke and flames were stilled, two trees suddenly grew up. In the midst of a blazing fire, with luxuriant leaves containing emeralds, they are called the ash bodhi tree.

source_sentence: 無憂王覩異悔過，以香乳溉餘根，洎乎將旦，樹生如本。
translation: King Aśoka repented and irrigated the remaining roots with scented milk. As soon as dawn approached, the tree grew as before.

source_sentence: 王見靈怪，重深欣慶，躬修供養，樂以忘歸。
translation: Seeing the miraculous apparition, the king was deeply delighted. He made offerings in person and forgot to return home with pleasure.

source_sentence: 王妃素信外道，密遣使人，夜分之後，重伐其樹。
translation: The king’s queen, who had always believed in heretical theories, secretly sent messengers to cut down the tree again after nightfall.

source_sentence: 無憂王旦將禮敬，唯見櫱株，深增悲慨，至誠祈請，香乳溉灌，不日還生。
translation: At dawn King Aśoka paid his respects to the image and saw that it was nothing but coarse plants. With deep sorrow he prayed earnestly, pouring scented milk over it so that it would not grow back any day.

source_sentence: 王深敬異，壘石周垣，其高十餘尺，今猶見在。
translation: The king deeply venerated it and built a stone wall more than ten feet high, which is still visible today.

source_sentence: 近設賞迦王者，信受外道，毀嫉佛法，壞僧伽藍，伐菩提樹，掘至泉水，
translation: Recently King Śaśāoka, a heretic believer in heretical theories and jealous of the buddha-dharma, destroyed the monastery, cut down the tree of enlightenment, and dug into the spring water.

source_sentence: 不盡根柢，乃縱火焚燒，以甘蔗汁沃之，欲其燋爛，絕滅遺萌。
translation: Without exhausting the roots and grapes, they are burned by fire and moistened with sugarcane juice. They will surely perish in the desire to be reduced to rotten and completely extinguished.

source_sentence: 數月後，摩揭陀國補剌拏伐摩王(唐言滿胄)，無憂王之末孫也，聞而歎曰：「慧日已隱，
translation: Several months later, King Pūrṇavarman (known as Manzhou in Chinese) of Magadha, a late descendant of King Aśoka, heard this and praised him, saying:

source_sentence: 唯餘佛樹，今復摧殘，生靈何覩！」
translation: Only the other buddha-trees have been left, and now they've been destroyed again, so what a pity for the living spirit!

source_sentence: 舉身投地，哀感動物。
translation: They raised their bodies and threw themselves to the ground, grieving for the animals.

source_sentence: 以數千牛搆乳而溉，經夜樹生，其高丈餘。
translation: He irrigated it with milk from several thousand cows and the tree grew overnight, more than one zhang in height.

source_sentence: 恐後剪伐，周峙石垣，高二丈四尺。
translation: It is feared that it will be cut down and surrounded by a stone wall, two zhang and four chi in height.

source_sentence: 故今菩提樹隱於石壁，出一丈餘。
translation: That’s why the tree of enlightenment is now hidden on a rocky wall more than one zhang in height.

source_sentence: 菩提樹東有精舍，高百六七十尺，下基面廣二十餘步，壘以青甎，塗以石灰，
translation: To the east of the bodhi tree there was a temple one hundred and sixty or seventy feet high, more than twenty paces in width with a base and a face over twenty paces wide. It was built of brick; plastered with blue tile and coated with limestone.

source_sentence: 層龕皆有金像，四壁鏤作奇製，或連珠形，或天仙像，上置金銅阿摩落迦果(亦謂寶瓶，
translation: Each of the multi-storied niches had a golden image carved on four walls, either in the shape of a series of pearls or an image of a celestial sage. On top was placed a golden copper vase made of amalaka fruit (also known as a precious vial).

source_sentence: 又稱寶臺)。

translation: Beside it is a stupa built at the place where Maitreya cooked gruel.

source_sentence: 次此窣堵波，如來受糜處也。
translation: Next, this stupa marks the place where the Tathāgata received the gruel.

source_sentence: 菩提樹垣南門外有大池，周七百餘步，清瀾澄鏡，龍魚潛宅，婆羅門兄弟承大自在天命之所鑿也。
translation: Outside the south gate of the enclosure of the bodhi tree is a large lake more than seven hundred paces in circuit, with clear, clear mirrors and cave dwelling places for dragons and fish. It was dug by the Brahman brothers under the command of Maheśvaradeva (i.e., Indra).

source_sentence: 次南一池，在昔如來初成正覺，方欲浣濯，天帝釋為佛化成池。
translation: The next to the south is a pond where Indra, the ruler of the gods, made a pond for the Buddha’s edification at the time when the Tathāgata was about to bathe after he had attained enlightenment.

source_sentence: 西有大石，佛浣衣已，方欲曝曬，天帝釋自大雪山持來也。
translation: To the west was a great rock that the Buddha had washed his robes before he wished to dry it. Sakka, ruler of the gods, brought it from the Great Snowy Mountains.

source_sentence: 其側窣堵波，如來於此納故衣。
translation: Beside it is a stupa built at the place where the Tathāgata wore his old clothes.

source_sentence: 次南林中窣堵波，如來受貧老母施故衣處。
translation: The next south is a stupa in the forest at the place where the Tathāgata accepted an old clothes donated by his poor and elderly mother.

source_sentence: 帝釋化池東，林中有目支隣陀龍王池，其水清黑，其味甘美。
translation: To the east of the pond Indra’s apparitional pond, there is a lake in the forest called Maudgalyāyana-nāga-rāja. The water is clear, dark, sweet, and delicious.

source_sentence: 西岸有小精舍，中作佛像。
translation: On the west bank is a small shrine, in which is enshrined an image of the Buddha.

source_sentence: 昔如來初成正覺，於此宴坐，七日入定。
translation: Formerly when the Tathāgata had first attained enlightenment he sat in meditation at this monastery for seven days and entered absorption.

source_sentence: 時此龍王警衛如來，即以其身繞佛七匝，化出多頭，俯垂為蓋，故池東岸有其室焉。
translation: The dragon king then guarded the Tathāgata, circled him seven times with his body around the Buddha, and magically produced many heads that fell down to form a canopy on the east bank of the old pond.

source_sentence: 目支隣陀龍池東，林中精舍有佛羸瘦之像。
translation: To the east of Mucilinda’s pond, in a forest to the east of the lake, there is a monastery with an image of the weak statue of the Buddha.

source_sentence: 其側有經行之所，長七十餘步，南北各有卑鉢羅樹。
translation: Beside it was a place for walking meditation more than seventy paces in length, and there were palm trees to the south and north of them.

source_sentence: 故今土俗，諸有嬰疾，香油塗像，多蒙除差。
translation: For this reason, according to the custom of the present-day land, if someone has an ailment and is covered with scented oil or coated with images, they are often cured.

source_sentence: 是菩薩修苦行處。
translation: This is the place where a bodhisattva cultivates austerities.

source_sentence: 如來為伏外道，又受魔請，於是苦行六年，日食一麻一麥，形容憔悴，
translation: The Tathāgata subdued the heretics and also accepted the invitation of Māra. Thus he practiced austerities for six years, eating only one grain of hemp and one grain of wheat every day, with an emaciated appearance.

source_sentence: 膚體羸瘠，經行往來，攀樹後起。
translation: His complexion was thin and emaciated, and he walked back and forth from one place to another. He climbed up behind the tree and got up.

source_sentence: 菩薩苦行卑鉢羅樹側有窣堵波，是阿若憍陳如等五人住處。
translation: Beside the bodhisattva's ascetic pepal tree is a stupa that marks the place where five people like Ajñātaśatru and Kauṇḍinya lived.

source_sentence: 初，太子之捨家也，彷徨山澤，棲息林泉，時淨飯王乃命五人隨瞻侍焉。
translation: At that time the prince renounced his householder’s life and wandered about in the mountains and swamps, dwelling in forests and streams. Then King Śuddhodana ordered five attendants to accompany him.

source_sentence: 太子既修苦行，憍陳如等亦即勤求。
translation: As the prince cultivated austerities, Kauṇḍinya and others also diligently sought them.

source_sentence: 憍陳如等住處東南有窣堵波，菩薩入尼連禪那河沐浴之處。
translation: To the southeast of the place where Kauṇḍinya and others lived is a stupa at the place where the Bodhisattva entered the Nairañjana River to bathe.

source_sentence: 河側不遠，菩薩於此受食乳糜。
translation: Not far from the river, the Bodhisattva received a meal of milk gruel at this place.

source_sentence: 其側窣堵波，二長者獻麨蜜處。
translation: Beside it is a stupa built at the place where two wealthy householders offered uncooked rice and honey.

source_sentence: 佛在樹下結加趺坐，寂然宴默，受解脫樂，過七日後，方從定起。
translation: The Buddha sat cross-legged under a tree, quietly and in meditation. After seven days had passed, he rose from his meditative state of absorption.

source_sentence: 時二商主行次林外，而彼林神告商主曰：「釋種太子今在此中，初證佛果，
translation: The two merchant leaders then proceeded to the outside of the forest. The deity of the forest said to the merchant leader, “The prince of the Śākya clan is now here.

source_sentence: 心凝寂定，四十九日未有所食，隨有奉上，獲大善利。」
translation: The mind is concentrated in a tranquil concentration for forty-nine days without food, and anyone who gives it to them will attain great good rewards.

source_sentence: 時二商主各持行資麨蜜奉上，世尊納受。
translation: The two merchant lords then each presented the food and drink to the Bhagavān, who accepted it.

source_sentence: 長者獻麨側有窣堵波，四天奉鉢處。
translation: Beside the place where the householder offered his almsbowl is a stupa at the place where the four heavenly gods offered their bowls.

source_sentence: 商主既獻麨蜜，世尊思以何器受之。
translation: The merchant lord offered the sweet honey, and the Bhagavān asked what container to accept it.

source_sentence: 時四天從四方來，各持金鉢，而以奉上。
translation: The four heavenly gods then came from the four directions, each carrying a golden bowl, and presented it to him.

source_sentence: 世尊默然，而不納受，以為出家不宜此器。
translation: The Bhagavān remained silent and didn't accept it, thinking that it wouldn't be appropriate for a renunciant to leave home with this container.

source_sentence: 四天王捨金鉢，奉銀鉢，乃至頗胝、琉璃、馬腦、車渠、真珠等鉢，世尊如是皆不為受。
translation: The four heavenly kings abandoned their golden bowls and presented them to the Buddha with silver bowls, as well as mahāprajñāpāramitā, lapis lazuli, 馬腦,車渠,真珠等 bowls. The World-honored One did not accept any of these bowls at all.

source_sentence: 四天王各還宮，奉持石鉢，紺青映徹，重以進獻。
translation: Each of the four heavenly kings returned to his palace and presented a stone bowl, shining brilliantly blue-colored.

source_sentence: 世尊斷彼此故，而總受之，次第重疊，按為一鉢，故其外則有四隆焉。
translation: The World-honored One accepted these bowls one after another and pressed them together into a single bowl. For this reason, the outside of the bowls are arranged in four ways.

source_sentence: 四天王獻鉢側不遠，有窣堵波，如來為母說法處也。
translation: Not far from the place where the four heavenly kings offered their bowls is a stupa at the place where the Tathāgata preached the Dharma to his mother.

source_sentence: 如來既成正覺，稱天人師，其母摩耶自天宮降於此處，世尊隨機示教利喜。
translation: When the Tathāgata had become perfectly enlightened and called himself a teacher of gods and humans, his mother Māya descended from the heavenly palace to this place, and the Bhagavān showed her how to benefit and delight in teaching him as she wished.

source_sentence: 其側涸池岸有窣堵波，在昔如來見諸神變化有緣處。
translation: On the bank of a dried-up pond beside it is a stupa built at the place where the Tathāgata saw miraculous transformations that had causal conditions in the past.

source_sentence: 現神變側有窣堵波，如來度優樓頻螺迦葉波三兄弟及千門人處。
translation: Beside the place where the Buddha manifested his miraculous powers is a stupa at the place where the Tathāgata delivered Uruvilvā-Kāśyapa three brothers and a thousand disciples were liberated.

source_sentence: 如來方垂善道，隨應降伏，時優樓頻螺迦葉波五百門人請受佛教，迦葉波曰：「吾亦與爾俱返迷途。」
translation: The Tathāgata then offered a good path and followed it as appropriate to subdue him, and the five hundred disciples of Uruvilvā-Kāśyapa invited them to accept the Buddha's teaching, and Kāśyapa said, I'll go back with you on my way.

source_sentence: 於是相從來至佛所。
translation: They then came from each other to the Buddha's place.

source_sentence: 如來告曰：「棄鹿皮衣，捨祭火具。」
translation: The Tathāgata told him, dispose of your deer skin robes and abandon the fire altar.

source_sentence: 時諸梵志恭承聖教，以其服用投尼連河。
translation: The priests then respectfully accepted the noble teaching and flew into the Nairañjāna river with it.

source_sentence: 捺地迦葉波見諸祭器隨流漂泛，與其門人候兄動靜，既見改轍，亦隨染衣。
translation: Seeing the sacrificial vessels floating along the river, Nadī Kāśyapa and his disciples were waiting for their elder brother to move in quietude. On seeing them, they changed their ways and dyed their clothes as well.

source_sentence: 伽耶迦葉波二百門人。
translation: Gayā-Kāśyapa had 200 disciples.

source_sentence: 聞其兄之捨法也，亦至佛所，願修梵行。
translation: Having heard that his elder brother had renounced the householder’s life, he also went to see the Buddha and wished to practice pure and genuine austerity.

source_sentence: 度迦葉波兄弟西北窣堵波，是如來伏迦葉波所事火龍處。
translation: To the northwest of the place where Kāśyapa’s brothers were converted is a stupa built at the place where the Tathāgata subdued the fire dragon worshiped by Kāśyapa.

source_sentence: 如來將化其人，克伏所宗，乃止梵志火龍之室。
translation: When the Tathāgata was about to convert those people, he defeated their theories and stayed in the chamber of the brahman's fire dragon.

source_sentence: 夜分已後，龍吐煙焰，佛既入定，亦起火光，其室洞然，猛焰炎熾。
translation: After the night was over, the dragon spit out smoke and flames. As the Buddha entered meditation, a light of fire also appeared. The cave became engulfed in flames and blazed hotly.

source_sentence: 諸梵志師恐火害佛，莫不奔赴，悲號愍惜。
translation: The priest teachers feared that the fire might harm the Buddha, so they all rushed there in distress and wailed in pity.

source_sentence: 優樓頻螺迦葉波謂其徒曰：「以今觀之，未必火也，當是沙門伏火龍耳。」
translation: Uruvilvā-Kāśyapa said to his disciples, Now that you're observing it, it might not necessarily be fire; it must be the ascetic who subdues the fire dragon.

source_sentence: 如來乃以火龍盛置鉢中，清旦持示外道門人。
translation: The Tathāgata then put the fire dragon in his bowl and showed it to the non-Buddhist disciples at dawn.

source_sentence: 其側窣堵波，五百獨覺同入涅槃處也。
translation: Beside it is a stupa built at the place where five hundred pratyekabuddhas entered nirvana together.

source_sentence: 目支隣陀龍池南窣堵波，迦葉波救如來溺水處也。
translation: To the south of Mucilinda’s pond is a stupa built at the place where Kāśyapa rescued the Tathāgata from being submerged in water.

source_sentence: 迦葉兄弟時推神通，遠近仰德，黎庶歸心。
translation: At that time the Kāśyapa brothers esteemed their supernatural powers and revered virtue from near and far. All the common people took refuge in them.

source_sentence: 世尊方導迷徒，大權攝化，興布密雲，降澍暴雨，周佛所居，令獨無水。
translation: The World-honored One guided the lost and deluded people. He had great power to collect and transform them, producing mysterious clouds that showered down torrential rain all over the Buddha’s dwelling place so that there would be no water for him alone.

source_sentence: 迦葉是時見此雲雨，謂門人曰：「沙門住處將不漂溺？」
translation: When Kāśyapa saw these clouds and rain, he said to his disciples, Will the place where the ascetic lives not drown?

source_sentence: 泛舟來救，乃見世尊履水如地，蹈河中流，水分沙現。
translation: He came to the rescue in a boat and saw that the World-honored One was walking on the surface of water, just as if he were walking on the ground.

source_sentence: 迦葉見已，心伏而退。
translation: Seeing this, Kāśyapa withdrew in distress.

source_sentence: 菩提樹垣東門外二三里，有盲龍室。
translation: Two or three li to the east of the enclosure of the bodhi tree is a room for the blind dragon two or three li away from the gate.

source_sentence: 此龍者，殃累宿積，報受生盲。
translation: This dragon is born blind as a result of accumulating bad karma accumulated in the past.

source_sentence: 如來自前正覺山欲趣菩提樹，途次室側，龍眼忽明，乃見菩薩將趣佛樹，
translation: In front of the enlightened buddha’s abode on Mount Zhengjue he wished to approach the tree of enlightenment. As he was proceeding along the road, at the side of his room a dragon eye suddenly became bright and saw that the enlightening being was about to enter the buddha-trees.

source_sentence: 謂菩薩曰：「仁今不久當成正覺。
translation: He said to the bodhisattva, Sir, it won't be long before you become perfectly enlightened.

source_sentence: 我眼盲冥，于茲已久，有佛興世，我眼輒明。
translation: My eyes have been blind and dull for a long time. When the Buddha appeared in the world, my eyes became clearer.

source_sentence: 賢劫之中，過去三佛出興世時，已得明視。
translation: In the past, during the good eon, when the three buddhas emerged in the world, they had already attained insight.

source_sentence: 仁今至此，我眼忽開，以故知之，當成佛矣。」
translation: Now that you've come here, my eyes suddenly open, so I know you will become a buddha.

source_sentence: 菩提樹垣東門側有窣堵波，魔王怖菩薩之處。
translation: Beside the east gate of the enclosure of the bodhi tree is a stupa built at the place where Māra King was frightened by the Bodhisattva.

source_sentence: 初，魔王知菩薩將成正覺也，誘亂不遂，憂惶無賴，集諸神眾，齊整魔軍，
translation: Knowing that the enlightening being was about to attain perfect enlightenment, the king of Māra seduced the enlightening being but could not do so. Fearful and distressed, he gathered his deities together to assemble an army of demons.

source_sentence: 治兵振旅，將脅菩薩。
translation: He governed the army and raised his troops, threatening the Bodhisattva.

source_sentence: 於是風雨飄注，雷電晦冥，縱火飛煙，揚沙激石，備矛楯之具，極弦矢之用。
translation: Then the wind and rain poured down, thunder and lightning flashed in the darkness of the night. Fire blazed high and smoke rose from the flames, and sand and stones were blown into the air to make rocks quake. They provided spears and shields that could only be used with stringed arrows or arrowheads.

source_sentence: 菩薩於是入大慈定，凡厥兵杖變為蓮華。
translation: The bodhisattva then entered the great compassionate concentration, and his staff turned into a lotus flower.

source_sentence: 魔軍怖駭，奔馳退散。
translation: The army of Māra was terrified and fled in haste.

source_sentence: 其側不遠有二窣堵波，帝釋、梵王之所建也。
translation: Not far from it are two stupas built by Indra and Brahmā.

source_sentence: 菩提樹北門外摩訶菩提僧伽藍，其先僧伽羅國王之所建也。
translation: Outside the north gate of the enlightenment tree is Mahāprajāpatī-saṃghārāma, built by the king of Siṃhala in the past.

source_sentence: 庭宇六院，觀閣三層，周堵垣牆高三四丈，極工人之妙，窮丹青之飾。
translation: The courts and buildings are of six stories in size, with three-story pavilions surrounded by enclosures and walls three or four zhang high. They are most exquisitely decorated by the finest artisans, adorned with the colors of red and blue.

source_sentence: 至於佛像，鑄以金銀，凡厥莊嚴，廁以珍寶。
translation: As for the images of the Buddha, they were made of gold and silver and adorned with rare treasures.

source_sentence: 諸窣堵波高廣妙飾，中有如來舍利，其骨舍利大如手指節。
translation: The stupas are high and wide and beautifully decorated, containing the relics of the Tathāgata. The bone relics are as big as a knuckle of one’s finger.

source_sentence: 光潤鮮白皎徹中外。
translation: It's shiny, pure, white, and brilliantly penetrating both inside and outside.

source_sentence: 其肉舍利如大真珠，色帶紅縹。
translation: His flesh and relics were as large as genuine pearls, red and white in color.

source_sentence: 每歲至如來大神變月滿之日，出示眾(即印度十二月三十日，當此正月十五日也)。
translation: Every year, on the full moon day of the Tathāgata's great miraculous month, he shows it to the crowd (this is the 30th day of the twelfth month in India, corresponding to the 15th day of the first month here).

source_sentence: 此時也，或放光，或雨花。
translation: At this time the moon sometimes emits light and sometimes it rains flowers.

source_sentence: 僧徒減千人，習學大乘、上座部法，律儀清肅，戒行貞明。
translation: There are less than a thousand monks who study the teachings of the Mahayana and Sthavira schools. Their disciplinary rules are pure and strict, and their morality is pure and genuine.

source_sentence: 昔者，南海僧伽羅國，其王淳信佛法，發自天然。
translation: Formerly the king of the country of Siṃhala in the South China Sea had faith in the buddha-dharma and came forth spontaneously.

source_sentence: 有族弟出家，想佛聖迹，遠遊印度，寓諸伽藍，咸輕邊鄙。
translation: A clansman renounced the householder’s life and thought of the holy sites of the Buddha. He traveled far from India to live in various monasteries, but all despised the vulgarity of the extremes.

source_sentence: 於是返迹本國，王躬遠迎，沙門悲耿，似若不能言。
translation: When he returned to his native land, the king himself greeted him from a distance. The śramaṇa was grieved and looked as if he could not speak.

source_sentence: 王曰：「將何所負，若此殷憂？」
translation: The king said, What's the point of being sad when you're so sad?

source_sentence: 沙門曰：「憑恃國威，遊方問道，羈旅異域，載罹寒暑，動遭凌辱，語見譏誚。
translation: The śramaṇa said, “Depending on the sovereignty of our country we traveled to different places to ask questions about the Way. Traveling in a foreign land, we suffered from cold and heat and were subject to various kinds of misfortune and criticized by others.

source_sentence: 負斯憂恥，詎得歡心？」
translation: To bear this kind of grief and shame, how can we rejoice?

source_sentence: 曰：「若是者何謂也？」
translation: He said, What's the meaning of this?

source_sentence: 曰：「誠願大王福田為意，於諸印度建立伽藍，既旌聖迹，又擅高名，
translation: He said, “I sincerely wish that Your Majesty’s field of blessedness will be so great as to establish a monastery in all the parts of India.

source_sentence: 福資先王，恩及後嗣。」
translation: It's a blessing that provided for the former king, his kindness, and his heirs.

source_sentence: 曰：「斯事甚美，聞之何晚？」
translation: He said, This is a very good thing; why is it so late to hear it?

source_sentence: 於是以國中寶獻印度王。
translation: He then offered the treasures of his country to the king of India.

source_sentence: 王既納貢，義存懷遠，謂使臣曰：「我今將何持報來命？」
translation: When the king accepted the tribute, Yi存 harbored a distant meaning and said to his envoy, What will I do now to sustain my life?

source_sentence: 使臣曰：「僧伽羅王稽首印度大吉祥王！
translation: The envoy said, King Saṃghârāma bowed his head to the great auspicious king of India!

source_sentence: 威德遠振，惠澤遐被，下土沙門，欽風慕化，敢遊上國，展敬聖迹，寓諸伽藍，
translation: His prestige and virtue spread far and wide, and his blessedness extended far and wide. The śramaṇas of the native land were fond of learning and they dared travel to other countries in order to show their respect for the holy sites so that they might live in monasteries.

source_sentence: 莫之見館，艱辛已極，蒙恥而歸。
translation: Don’t let him see the monastery, for he was overcome with a sense of shame and returned home.

source_sentence: 竊圖遠謀，貽範來葉，於諸印度建此伽藍，使客遊乞士，息肩有所，兩國交歡，
translation: I secretly plotted to construct this monastery from distant lands in various parts of India, so that the beggars who were invited to visit it would be able to do so. The two kingdoms lived side by side in peace and rejoicing.

source_sentence: 行人無替。」
translation: The practitioner doesn't change.

source_sentence: 王曰：「如來潛化，遺風斯在，聖迹之所，任取一焉。」
translation: The king said, The Tathāgata was latently transformed, and the legacy of his teachings are still there; he's free to take one of the holy sites.

source_sentence: 使者奉辭報命，群臣拜賀，遂乃集諸沙門，評議建立。
translation: The envoyant obeyed the king’s order and all his ministers greeted him. So they assembled the śramaṇas to discuss the establishment of the monastery.

source_sentence: 沙門曰：「菩提樹者，去來諸佛咸此證聖，考之異議，無出此謀。」
translation: The ascetic said, The bodhi tree is a place where all the buddhas of past and future realize sagehood, and there's no way to get rid of this plot.

source_sentence: 於是捨國珍寶，建此伽藍，以其國僧而修供養，乃刻銅為記曰：「夫周給無私，
translation: He then abandoned the country’s treasures and built this monastery, making offerings to all the monks of his country. Then he carved a copper image inscribed with the following words:

source_sentence: 諸佛至教；

translation: Wisdom and relief have conditions, which are explained in the teachings of the first sage.

translation: The Indian monks, in accordance with the Buddha’s holy teachings, all entered these two summer retreats on the sixteenth day of the first half-month before Śrāvastī, corresponding to the sixteenth day of the fifth month.

translation: On the fifteenth day of the second half of the month in Kuśinagara, corresponding to the fifteenth day of the eighth month in our calendar, the two summer retreats were dissolved.

translation: In India the name of the moon is derived from the stars; it is not easy to distinguish between ancient and modern. There is no difference among the different schools.
